ratings.comment: Sometimes was a little disorganized, but he just had a kid so maybe it was that. He's pretty goood.

This guy made me work, and I don't even think I got an A. But still, this class was worth it. He gives good  feedback, even on assignments that don't affect your grade. He also lays out all the work in advance pretty clearly, so I was able to plan around the busier parts of the semester.

Ptak isnt a very difficult instructor, but you will not enjoy the experience of being in his class. He has tendencies to be incredibly politically correct to an extent where its annoying, and at the same time he manages numerous repeated microaggressions across a semester. His feedback also sucks and he has way to much energy for 9 in the morning

He's a great professor if you have goals and aspirations. If you want a class that you can blow off, maybe don't take a language class, but if you want to learn, he is very helpful, good at explaining things, and accommodating if you have trouble and need help. He is by far the most engaging and best language teacher I've had so far.

His comments on essays seem tough, but his grades are not tough. If you go talk to him about your work, you might both end up laughing about it. We met after he graded my essay so I can ask for more feedback and it was super useful. Also, this is for French 211, I don't know why French 204 is the only option on this website.

Luke is full of energy and it's too much for 8 in the morning — no actually it's just too much period. He grades very harshly on assignments that are not meant to have a "correct" answer. This is a literature course not math 638. It's an extremely easy course and easy subject in general but I guess his ego gets ahead of him.
Luke is the best teacher I've ever had- UW and otherwise, French department and otherwise. Super great guy! I highly recommend taking a class with him if possible!
